prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: S. S. Van Dine Photograph Collection, 1900-1939, Accession #9701-b , Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was given to the Library by John Loughery, New York, New York, on October 1, 1992.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Photographs assembled by John Loughery while researching his biography of Willard Huntington Wright, entitled Alias S. S. Van Dine. The collection includes scenes from S. S. Van Dine - Philo Vance movies; photographs of Van Dine, his wife, and dogs; photographs of his brother's artwork; and photographs of drawings and caricatures of him by Thomas Hart Benton, James Montgomery Flagg and Langdon Smith together with some miscellaneous items.

did.unittitle: A Photograph from the Benson Murder Case Motion Picture ca. 1930
Photographs from the Bishop Murder Case Motion Picture 1930

Photographs from the Canary Murder Case Motion Picture
1927-1928
Photographs from the Dragon Murder Case Motion Picture 1934
Photographs from the Greene Murder Case Motion Picture ca. 1929
A Photograph from the Kennel Murder Case Motion Picture 1933

scopecontent.p: Including the Arcadia Hotel in Santa Monica (the Wright's first home in California); the first page of two newspaper articles about Wright, "A Literary Vivisectionist" and "Los Angeles-City of Dreadful Night; California reactions to Willard's The Smart Setbroadside; covers from The Smart Setfor January and February, 1914; Scribner's ad for the first book of the Philo Vance series, 1926; and Van Dine at work in the penthouse (circa 1935).

did.unittitle:
Photographs of the Artwork of Stanton Macdonald Wright
1913-1922

scopecontent.p: The brother of Willard Wright, including three copies of a portrait of Wright by Stanton Macdonald Wright.

Including two of Wright as a boy at the New York Military Academy, Bard Hall; one of Wright as the literary editor of the Los Angeles Times; photograph introducing Wright to the readers of The Smart Set; and a variety of photographs from later in his career when he had begun writing the Philo Vance mysteries.

did.unittitle:
Photographs: Willard Huntington Wright Drawings & Caricatures
1916-1934

scopecontent.p: Including a drawing of Wright by Thomas Hart Benton, caricature of Willard that appeared in the San Francisco Bulletin; a drawing by James Montgomery Flagg, used as a publicity photograph by Scribner for The Casino Murder Case; a caricature by James Montgomery Flagg of "The Real S.S. Van Dine" viewing him as a devil; and an engraved picture of Wright by Langdon Smith which appeared in The West Coast Magazine.
